oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Mary Warner Mallison, 1976 August 28, excerpt 02
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Mary Warner Mallison, conducted on 28 August 1976 by Ophelia Paine as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project. Mallison discusses living at her family's home, Renraw (Warner spelled backwards), where her grandmother ran a boarding house. The complete interview is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mallison, Mary Thomas Warner, 1893-1981--Interviews
Renraw (Nashville, Tenn.)
Popular Culture; Architecture; Buildings; Buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Boardinghouses--Tennessee--Nashville; Extended families--Tennessee--Nashville
